item.title: central similitude
item.description: an enlargement/shrinking with a given center ($O$) and scale factor ($\lambda$)

item.title: congruence
item.description: when two shapes have the same size and shape $\text{E.g.:} \Delta ABC \cong \Delta DEF$ congruent shapes are ‘equal’ in the geometric sense

item.title: congruence of two triangles
item.description: one side with two angles on it (ASA) two sides with one angle between them (SAS) three sides (SSS) two sides with one angle opposite the longer side

item.title: Congruencies
item.description: reflection in a line reflection in a point rotation (around a point) shift/translation (by a vector)

item.title: similarity of two triangles
item.description: [!info] Two triangles are similar if three equal angles two proportional sides and one equal angle between them three proportional sides two proportional sides with one equal angle opposite the longer side

item.title: similitude
item.description: the combinaiton of a [[central similitude]] and [[congruencies]] similitudes preserve … angles ratios [[similarity of two triangles]]

item.title: Theorem of parallel transversals
item.description: $\Delta XBC \sim \Delta XAD$ ← [[central similitude]] with center $O$ ![[Theorem of transversal segments]] Theorem of parallel transversals $$\frac{AB}{CD}=\frac{EF}{GH}$$

item.title: Theorem of transversal segments
item.description: [!info]- Diagram $$\frac{AD}{BC}=\frac{XA}{XB}=\frac{XD}{XC}$$ the ratio is the scale factor of central similitude
